question: My question is can we as Hanafi's perform Witr behind a Shafee Imam and vice versa
answer:
QUESTION

During Ramadaan, the huffaaz take turns to perform Esha and Witr Salaat - At the time of Witr, the Shafee Imam and a few of the Shafee musallees go to the back to perform the witr. We find this against the spirit of brotherhood, as all of us prayed the Esha and Taraweeh together, so why can we not pray the witr together.

My question is can we as Hanafi's perform Witr behind a Shafee Imam and vice versa

ANSWER


Share:

It is permissible for a Hanafi to follow a Shaafi’ee Imaam in Witr provided the Shaafi’ee Imaam does not make salaam at the end of 2 Rakaats and at the time of commencing Witr he makes a general intention of performing Witr, i.e. does not specify Sunnah / Nafl, etc. (Imdaadul Ahkaam vol.1 pg.597)

He should also abide by the laws of Tahaara according to the Hanafi Madhab. (Tabyeenul Haqaaiq vol.1 pg.427; Beirut)

and Allah Ta'ala Knows Best

Mufti Ebrahim Desai
